As India is committed to bringing down its share of global emissions by 2030 as per the Paris climate agreement, replacing diesel and petrol vehicles with electric vehicles will help us in achieving this goal.

Conclusion: India should transition to electric vehicles

Conclusion: Consumerism brings more harm than good

Conclusion: Indian government should increase the minimum legal age of marriage for girls from 18 to 21 years

After the pandemic, the number of child marriages increased significantly. So, the problem lies in the implementation. Conclusion: We should not forget about indigenous Europeans
Premise: Sounds a little xenophobic. There is no concept of indigenous or aborigenous population in Europe, the only criteria is citizenship.

Conclusion: We should impose an IQ test to immigrants
Premise: Some of the 9/11 Terrorists were well educated. IQ proves nothing, I'd better welcome good people than smart people.

Conclusion: We should not allow solar power plants to be used to damage nature.
Premise: I absolutely agree that solar power plants should not be deployed on fertile, arable land & wood should not be cut down to make place for this endeavor. This needs to be regulated swiftly!

Conclusion: We should include all costs of nuclear energy in our comparisons, for example insurance and disposal
Premise: If you want to do it for nuclear power, then it would be better to do it for every single kind of energy production methods. It’s also important then to include the complete cycle of all the energies, the human cost, the extraction of primary resources, in the case of renewable energy, take into account the necessary energy storage, and so on and so forth.

Conclusion: We should reduce animal farming.
Premise: We can work together to encourage plant based diets and make the world a better place.

Conclusion: We should stop the European Commission’s Ideological bias toward migration.
Premise: The European’s Commission communication and political thinking on migration are biased, falsely naïve, and Ideological.

Conclusion: We should remove unauthorized asylum seekers or migrants.
Premise: No more immigration from non-European or non-first world countries.

Conclusion: We should not have any immigration from non-European or non-first-world countries
Premise: Halting all immigration to EU from non-European or non-first-world countries will lead to an even more competitive advantage for the USA and other countries as our population is shrinking rapidly.

Conclusion: We should not have any immigration from non-European or non first-world countries
Premise: Saying no to any migration is just stupid and irrealistic.

Conclusion: We should stop making one-cent coins
Premise: A one-cent coin costs about 60% more to produce than it is actually worth.

Conclusion: We should stop daylight saving time change
Premise: Imposing the time change allows having more hours of light in summer, which gives an energy saving. I know that some studies say that savings would be minimal, but we must consider the growing European energy dependence on photovoltaics: We humans consume more electricity when we are awake, the photovoltaic gives a good availability of energy but only during the day and is difficult to store, to overlap the moment of energy availability given by photovoltaics (the hours of light) with the moment in which citizens have the most energy needs I think it can eventually save more energy in the future.

Conclusion: We should legalize non-violent drug offenses
Premise: We should legalize drugs as a means to promote justice, harm reduction, and religious freedom.  If we really want justice and human rights, this is absolutely essential.

Conclusion: We should put the accent on traditional values and on preserving family life
Premise: The traditional family is the cornerstone of European civilization.

Conclusion: We should punish illegal Immigrants and only accept legal immigrants.
Premise: We would have to change asylum rules. Illegal immigrants will claim asylum after entering the country to attempt to make their entry legal. It then becomes a massive pain to deport them. Illegal entries must result in an automatic rejection of asylum claims.

Conclusion: We should not have any immigration from non-European or non first-world countries
Premise: Saying no to any migration is just stupid and irrealistic.

Conclusion: We should protect the European border
Premise: Frontex deserves much more political support, especially from the European Commission. It is already playing an important role to manage the border and is called to play a crucial one in the coming years.

Conclusion: We should strengthen Frontex and control immigration
Premise: Bigger financial resources for Frontex and military action in Syria will stop the conflict.

Conclusion: We should rethink the legal state of Family Reunification.
Premise: Illegal loopholes in the legislation are enabling illegal migration. Family Reunification has been and remains the biggest channel of migration into the EU.

Conclusion: We should shift the EU policy toward the Russian Federation
Premise: Belarus, Russia, and Ukraine are by far the most important neighbors of the EU. A good relationship with all three is very desirable for the EU. For that, we would have to be willing to understand their history better.

Conclusion: We should shift the EU policy toward the Russian Federation
Premise: The Russian Federation is our neighbor. We share common historic and cultural ties with them. Today the EU confronts Russia with sanctions. An understandable reaction to its actions in Ukraine and failing democracy. Let us not forget actions done by others (US intervention in Iraq, the Chinese in Tibet and their treatment of minorities, etc.). Yet we close our eyes.

Conclusion: We should abolish the 996 overtime system
Premise: For the poor people, if they can go to the Internet factory, China's 996 overtime system is a blessing, twelve hours a day, six days a week, can also rest a day, quite good.

Conclusion: We should abolish the 996 overtime system
Premise: China's 996 overtime system violates labor laws.

Conclusion: We should protect our privacy in the Internet age.
Premise: Most people have to rely on centralized information distribution and dissemination platforms to publish information. It is easy to control the output and control of ideology, social ideas and hotspots.

Conclusion: We should restrict minors from playing online games.
Premise: Instead of banning games, it might be better to increase young people's awareness of life and society, and to promote self-awareness and active thinking among students.

Conclusion: We should open up three-child policy to encourage childbirth.
Premise: The people at the Health Planning Commission thought there would be a population explosion after opening up childbirth, but in reality people don't want to have children, whether you restrain them or not.

Conclusion: We should ease the education involution.
Premise: A society's value of education should not remain "score-only" and "testing-only".
